name: Shadflower, Spring draba, Whitlow grass
overview: This annual herb is native to both the Americas and Europe. The herb is 'anthropogenic' which means that it prefers man-made or disturbed habitats. Blooms from February to May and is not endangered.
habitat: Draba verna can be found in meadows, fields, and foothills.
tags: Spiky pineapple-like purple stems White flowers plants plant
